item.title: How To Watch the 2025 NHL Preseason
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Before the NHL regular season begins, each team will compete in a series of preseason matchups starting in September. We dusted off our skates to deliver a complete look at how to watch this year’s NHL preseason.

The post How To Watch the 2025 NHL Preseason appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Before the puck drops on the 2025–2026 NHL regular season, each team will compete in a series of preseason matchups starting September 20, 2025. NHL Network and TNT will televise select games nationwide, but most preseason hockey action airs on regional sports networks (RSNs).

Stream with DIRECTV is my favorite service for catching the NHL preseason. It comes with every national NHL channel and offers most RSNs based on your location. But if you support a team far from home, you’ll want ESPN+ for out-of-market streaming access.

Keep reading for more info on NHL preseason channels and recommended TV services. We also have a section dedicated to the full preseason schedule so you can quickly check game times.

Jump to:

  • NHL preseason channels
  • NHL preseason TV schedule
  • Best NHL preseason TV plans
  • Watch the NHL preseason for free

Don’t miss preseason hockey on TV!

Score the best TV plan in your area by entering your zip code below.

What channels are NHL preseason games on?

NHL preseason channels are a bit of a mixed bag. Most games air locally on regional sports networks or stream with geo-restrictions on each team’s official website. NHL Network and TNT broadcast some matchups nationwide, and you can stream many out-of-market preseason games on ESPN+.

Want radio coverage? While not all NHL preseason games appear on TV, you can listen to game audio through team radio affiliates online via TuneIn.

2025 NHL preseason schedule

This year’s NHL preseason runs from September 21 to October 5. Like previous seasons, the two-week period includes neutral-site exhibition games happening domestically and internationally. Buffalo Sabres fans in Germany will get a special treat as the NHL Global Series makes a preseason stop at SAP Garden in Munich.

Best TV plans for watching the NHL preseason

The best TV plans for watching the NHL preseason depend on the games you wish to see. If you prefer having access to every preseason duel, you’ll want DIRECTV STREAM and ESPN+.

DIRECTV STREAM will get you every national NHL channel and your regional sports network, while ESPN+ provides out-of-market access. Together, DIRECTV STREAM with a standalone ESPN+ subscription is the most expensive route for NHL fans. It’s also unnecessary if you want only the televised games featuring your favorite team. In that case, you may look to one of these options:

  1. Local games: Watching locally televised NHL preseason games is tricky because every team has different TV affiliates. In most cases, you’ll need a TV provider like DIRECTV STREAM or Fubo to get RSN access. Otherwise, depending on your local team’s broadcaster, a simple TV antenna can pick up games over the air.
  2. Out-of-market games: ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice carry out-of-market NHL games. You won’t get every out-of-market preseason game because not every game airs on TV, but ESPN+ is a great streaming option for only $10.99 a month.
  3. National games: Sling TV is the cheapest way to get national NHL channels like ESPN, NHL Network, and TNT. All you’ll need is the Sling Orange plan ($45.99/mo.) and the Sports Extra add-on ($11.00/mo.).

How to watch the NHL preseason for free

Unfortunately, no straightforward viewing methods exist to watch NHL preseason games for free. In some metropolitan areas with NHL teams, you might catch a few matchups using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna—such as KMCC in Las Vegas airing Vegas Golden Knights preseason games. However, this option is not viable for most NHL fans, especially if you don’t live near your favorite team.

While scouring Reddit for free NHL streams is possible, we don’t endorse that approach due to its illegality, unreliability, and potential risks to your streaming device. Instead, a legitimate and inexpensive option is subscribing to ESPN+ at $11.99 a month, which will provide access to many matchups with no additional commitments.

Are all NHL preseason games on TV?

Most NHL preseason games appear on TV or online, although some matchups may not have an official broadcast. Regional blackout restrictions can also prevent certain games from airing in your area.

For in-market coverage, you’ll need a TV plan with your local team’s regional sports network. You can also explore out-of-market options like ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice if you support a non-local team. In cases where no viewing option is available, games are typically still accessible through each team’s radio partner.

How to watch the NHL preseason FAQ

Can you stream NHL preseason games?

Yes, you can stream NHL preseason games on any live TV streaming service that offers NHL Network, TNT, and your local team’s RSN affiliate. ESPN+ also carries select out-of-market games during the preseason.

Are NHL preseason games blacked out?

Yes, broadcasting blackouts occur for all locally televised NHL preseason games. In-market games will appear on RSNs, while ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice will show some out-of-market matchups.

Does NHL Center Ice include preseason games?

Yes, NHL Center Ice carries select out-of-market preseason games. Unlike the regular season, NHL Center Ice doesn’t offer complete out-of-market access during the preseason. Blackout restrictions may also prevent certain games from airing in your area.

Where can I watch NHL preseason games in Canada?

In Canada, some NHL preseason games air nationally on Sportsnet, Sportsnet ONE, and TSN. Sportsnet+ (formerly Sportsnet NOW) will show select out-of-market preseason games, while in-market games may appear on TSN’s regional networks and individual team websites.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports editor, Taylor Kujawa, conducted thorough research and hands-on testing to identify the best ways to watch this year’s NHL preseason. He compiled a comprehensive list of preseason matchups and channel listings. Utilizing that data, he compared popular TV providers to determine the most efficient way to watch the most games—considering in-market, out-of-market, and nationally televised broadcasts.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Cincinnati Reds Season
item.dc:creator: David Vick
item.description:
And this one belongs to the Reds! Find out how to watch Cincinnati Reds baseball all year long. Our viewing guide features their TV schedule and channel lineup.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Cincinnati Reds Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Cincinnati Reds will make history this season when they play in the MLB Speedway Classic on August 2. This first-of-its-kind event will feature the Reds taking on the Atlanta Braves inside Bristol Motor Speedway, one of NASCAR’s most popular tracks.

Yes, you read that right. Baseball at a racing venue. I hope you’re as excited as I am to watch the game and everything that comes with it.

The Speedway Classic is the highlight of the Reds’ regular season, but the team does have 161 other games on the 2025 calendar. In the guide below, I’ll walk you through how to watch every single one, from the must-have channels to the full TV schedule.

Jump to:

  • Cincinnati Reds channels
  • Best Cincinnati Reds TV plans
  • Cincinnati Reds TV schedule

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Cincinnati Reds games?

As the regional home for the Cincinnati Reds in 2025, FanDuel Sports Network Ohio (FDSOH) will broadcast most of the team’s games. The Reds will also make appearances on Apple TV+, FOX, FS1, MLB Network, and TBS.

Out-of-market fans will need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch Reds games that air on FDSOH.

Want additional coverage? You can watch Reds Live, the team’s 30-minute pre- and postgame show, on FanDuel Sports Network Ohio.

Best TV plans for watching the Cincinnati Reds

Do you want to watch the Cincinnati Reds battle for their first playoff appearance since 2020? Of course you do, that’s why I’ve broken down the best TV plans to help you catch every single game.

The only platform or channel not covered through these viewing options is Apple TV+, which requires a separate subscription.

Fubo ($14.99–$94.99/mo.)

Fubo has been my go-to choice for fans looking to watch their favorite MLB team this season. With 234 channels in Fubo’s Pro plan, including FanDuel Sports Network Ohio, local fans can watch every Reds game and enjoy a whole lot more entertainment outside of baseball. Fubo also includes Lookback, a feature I love. It lets you watch content on demand up to 72 hours after it originally aired.

While I love what Fubo has to offer, it does include a required regional sports fee. This can cost up to $16.99 per month, depending on where you live. That fee stings a little, but Fubo is still the most affordable way to watch the Reds when compared to other TV providers.

FanDuel Sports Network ($19.99/mo.)

In-market fans can subscribe to FanDuel Sports Network (FDSN) to watch every Reds game that isn’t nationally televised. While FDSN is the only standalone TV package available for local Reds fans, I think it’s a really good choice.

The pricing is transparent, and it’s accessible on most devices. There are also no local blackouts, which is one less thing to stress about during the season. (Again, just watch out for those Apple TV+ exclusives.)

From now until August 31, new FDSN subscribers can use promo code REDSBOGO to buy one month and get the second month free. With the biggest games of the season yet to be played, this is a can’t-miss offer.

Score the best TV plan!

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

2025 Cincinnati Reds playoffs TV schedule

The Reds have their work cut out for them as they head into the Wild Card series against the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers. They’ll have to win on the road and deal with the likes of Shohei Ohtani to pull off what I think would be considered a huge upset.

Check out the Reds’ full postseason schedule in the table below.

How to watch the Cincinnati Reds FAQ

Can I watch the Cincinnati Reds for free?

Yes, you can watch the Cincinnati Reds for free with an over-the-air antenna when games air on national channels like FOX. The FCC’s Reception Map Tool is a great resource for looking up which channels are available where you live.

Is TBS an over-the-air channel?

No, TBS is not an over-the-air channel. You need a TV provider or a higher-tier HBO Max subscription to watch Cincinnati Reds games that air on TBS.

How do I find out if I live in the Reds’ TV territory?

The easiest way to confirm if you live in the Reds’ TV territory is to visit GetMyHomeTeams.com and enter your zip code. Generally, the team’s in-market broadcast region covers most of Ohio, Kentucky, Indiana, and West Virginia, plus parts of Pennsylvania and New York.

Are regional Reds games on a different channel in 2025?

No, regional Reds games are on the same channel that they were on last season. It was just rebranded from Bally Sports to FanDuel Sports Network in October 2024.

Does FanDuel Sports Network offer multiple subscription plans?

Yes, FanDuel Sports Network offers multiple subscription plans. Reds fans can choose a monthly, seasonal, or annual plan.

Why you should trust us

To make sure Cincinnati Reds fans know how to watch every game on TV this season, I gathered the broadcast information for all 162 matchups on the team’s 2025 schedule. I then organized the key details into this easy-to-understand viewing guide that can only be found on CableTV.com—your source for everything TV, internet, and streaming.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The Milwaukee Brewers return for this MLB season looking to build on last year’s National League Central triumph. Fortunately, you can watch all Brewers games live with the right channels in your TV roster.

The post How To Watch the Milwaukee Brewers in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Looking to watch the Milwaukee Brewers today? Fortunately, you can catch all Brewers games live with the right channels and TV setup.

The Brew Crew is rolling through the 2025 MLB season with a ton of momentum, proving last year’s National League Central triumph was no fluke. With head coach Pat Murphy at the helm, the team is embracing a new era—navigating through changes while keeping its World Series dreams alive.

Although MLB was going to take over broadcasting the Brewers’ in-market games, the team ultimately struck a deal to keep local matchups on FanDuel Sports Wisconsin (formerly Bally Sports Wisconsin). That means many TV details remain unchanged from last season. But keep reading, as I outline this season’s viewing specifics—including the complete TV schedule and free viewing options.

Jump to:

  • Milwaukee Brewers channels
  • Milwaukee Brewers TV schedule
  • Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Brewers for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Milwaukee Brewers games?

You can watch in-market Milwaukee Brewers games on FanDuel Sports Network Wisconsin (FDSWI), with select simulcasts airing on over-the-air affiliates throughout Wisconsin. Nationally televised games will appear on FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network, while some will stream on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

If you live outside the FanDuel Sports Wisconsin broadcast region, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS for out-of-market viewing.

Want radio coverage? Fans can stream home and away radio broadcasts of every Brewers game on MLB At Bat. Games also air on AM and FM stations within the Brewers Radio Network, featuring announcers Jeff Levering, Lane Grindle, and Josh Maurer.

Score the best Milwaukee Brewers TV plan

Enter your zip code below to see top TV and internet providers in your area.

2025 Milwaukee Brewers playoffs TV schedule

The Brewers began the 2025 MLB season with an Opening Day loss against the New York Yankees. In fact, they lost that entire opening series. But you wouldn’t know it now, as Milwaukee rolled into October with the spot in the National League Division Series.

Starting Saturday, October 4, the Brewers will start their journey toward a World Series against the winner of the Wild Card series between the San Diego Padres and Chicago Cubs, which is currently underway.

The full schedule is below as we know it right now. I’ll update it as more info becomes available.

How to watch the Milwaukee Brewers for free

Get Free Local Channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)

Mohu Leaf 50 ($46.99, one-time purchase†)

ABC and FOX

All local broadcast channels

Read Mohu Leaf review

†CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

You can watch select Milwaukee Brewers games for free on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, which requires no TV subscription. To identify channels in your area, enter your zip code in the FCC’s Reception Map Tool. Then, explore our Best OTA Antennas page for recommendations, including the mid-range Mohu Leaf 50.

Free MLB games also stream daily on MLB.TV. All you need is an MLB.com account to tune in, but blackout restrictions apply for in-market fans.

Another way to watch free games is through a live TV streaming trial. DIRECTV STREAM offers a free five-day trial with core MLB channels and RSNs, including FanDuel Sports Wisconsin. Other free trials are regularly available through Fubo and YouTube TV.

How to watch the Milwaukee Brewers FAQ

Can I watch the Brewers game on Amazon Prime?

Yes, out-of-market Brewers fans can watch games on Amazon Prime Video through the MLB.TV Prime Video Channels add-on. In-market coverage is also available on Prime Video with the FanDuel Sports Network add-on.

Have the Brewers returned to FanDuel Sports Network?

Yes, Brewers games will remain on FanDuel Sports Network (formerly Bally Sports) for the 2025 MLB season. In December 2024, the Brewers announced that they reached an agreement for FanDuel Sports Network to produce and distribute the team’s telecasts for another year.

How can I watch the Brewers on Spectrum?

Spectrum TV customers can watch nationally televised Brewers games on ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. In-market fans can get FanDuel Sports Wisconsin with the TV Select Plus plan, while MLB EXTRA INNINGS is available for out-of-market fans.

Does YouTube TV carry Brewers games?

Yes, YouTube TV carries select Brewers games that air nationally. But the live TV streaming service doesn’t offer FanDuel Sports Wisconsin, MLB Network, or MLB.TV access.

How can I stream the Brewers?

You can stream Milwaukee Brewers games on any live TV streaming service that offers ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. Sling TV is an inexpensive option, but I recommend DIRECTV STREAM for better in-market coverage. You can also stream in-market games on FanDuel Sports Network and out-of-market coverage on MLB.TV.

Why you should trust us

As a Wisconsin native and lifelong Brewers fan, our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, knows exactly what it takes to follow the Brew Crew. For this guide, he combined that fan passion with expert analysis, cross-referencing the full 2025 schedule with the channel lineups and pricing of every major TV provider to find the best deals for Brewers fans.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Upcoming sports events FAQ

What’s the biggest sports event in the U.S.?

Many NFL games are among the most-watched sports events in the U.S., with the Super Bowl taking the top spot. Other popular sports events on TV include the College Football National Championship, the Final Four of March Madness, and the Kentucky Derby.

What sport has the longest calendar season?

MLB has one of the longest calendars in major league sports, with teams playing 162 games during the regular season. But other sports like the PGA Tour, ATP Tour, and NASCAR have shorter offseasons. Also, combat sports like UFC and Bellator MMA happen year-round with no set seasons.

What athletic event is held every four years?

Several marquee sports events happen every four years, like the FIFA World Cup, Summer Olympics, and Winter Olympics. Other notable events like the America’s Cup, Ryder Cup, and World Baseball Classic are also non-annual.

Why you should trust us

Our sports experts conducted extensive research to build a comprehensive calendar of major upcoming sports events on TV. Leveraging years of expertise in covering sports broadcasts, we cross-checked start dates and channel listings with trusted sources—including leagues and broadcasters—to provide the most reliable viewing options.

We update this guide monthly to ensure accuracy, as some dates and times change throughout the year. Check out our How We Rank page for a closer look at our methods.

item.title: How To Stream Music Festivals in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Bring the concert to your living room! We’ve compiled a guide to the year’s biggest music festivals available to stream online.

The post How To Stream Music Festivals in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 music festival season is in full swing, and you can stream many of the year’s biggest events from home. While some festivals like Coachella and a cut-short Bonnaroo have already wrapped up, there’s still plenty of live music to come.

This year, Hulu remains the exclusive streaming home for three prolific festivals: Bonnaroo, Lollapalooza, and Austin City Limits. All you need is a base plan subscription (starting at $9.99 a month) to get live access to these massive concert series.

Keep reading for details on the upcoming Lollapalooza and Austin City Limits streams, plus an expanded guide to other key concerts and music events you can watch in 2025.

Jump to:

  • Music festival schedule
  • Other ways to watch live concerts

Looking for the hottest entertainment?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest TV event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

How to watch Bonnaroo live

Hulu streamed part of the 2025 Bonnaroo Music and Arts Festival in June, only for it to get canceled due to severe weather in Manchester, Tennessee. The four-day event would’ve featured country, rock, and rap headliners like Luke Combs, Olivia Rodrigo, Vampire Weekend, and Tyler, The Creator.

How to watch Lollapalooza live

Lollapalooza will return to Grant Park in Chicago on July 31, 2025. Hulu will stream the four-day festival again, with headliners including Olivia Rodrigo, Sabrina Carpenter, A$AP Rocky, and Tyler, The Creator.

While Hulu hosted Lollapalooza in the past, none of those live sets are available to watch on demand through the streaming service. But you can find many past performances on each artist’s YouTube page. (We frequently rewatch Tyler, The Creator’s 2021 Lolla set for its pure, contagious energy.)

How to watch Austin City Limits live

Hulu will once again provide live-streaming coverage of the Austin City Limits Music Festival in October. Produced by C3 Presents, the 2025 ACL Fest lineup includes an exciting blend of artists ranging from Hozier and The Strokes to Sabrina Carpenter and Doechii.

Looking for the best home internet service?

Enter your zip code below to view the top internet providers available in your area.

2025 music festival schedule

Many music festivals are returning to the stage in 2025. We’ve highlighted some of our favorite ones in the table below.

Not every event is available to watch online, but some may offer remote viewing options. For instance, both weekends of Coachella 2025 will stream on YouTube, while BBC iPlayer is the streaming home of Glastonbury Festival.

Other ways to watch live concerts

Live virtual concerts aren’t as popular as they were in 2020 and 2021. But there are still several ways to watch full music shows online.

YouTube is one of the most accessible websites for streaming live music. Its YouTube Music streaming service populates a free Live Performances playlist, featuring anything from award show performances to studio sessions.

Streaming services like Amazon Prime Video, HBO Max, and Netflix also host several on-demand concert films and documentaries. But Paramount+ is the go-to destination if you want MTV and VH1 content like MTV Unplugged and Behind the Music.

How to stream music festivals FAQ

Can you stream Coachella?

Yes, you can stream live performances from Coachella on YouTube for free. In early 2023, Coachella and YouTube expanded their partnership through 2026.

Can you watch Lollapalooza for free?

No, you can’t watch Lollapalooza for free. You’ll need a Hulu subscription to tune in, but sometimes the streaming service offers a 30-day free trial.

Is the iHeartRadio Music Festival on Hulu?

Yes, you can watch the iHeartRadio Music Festival with a standard Hulu subscription. The 2025 event also streamed live on the iHeartRadio app.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Philadelphia Phillies Season
item.dc:creator: David Vick
item.description:
Is this the year the Phillies win another World Series? Stay tuned with our viewing guide, featuring the complete TV schedule, channel listings, and streaming options.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Philadelphia Phillies Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Philadelphia Phillies have done a lot of winning over the past three seasons, but they haven’t been able to break through and win a third World Series in franchise history. They came close in 2022, but it wasn’t meant to be. With most of their key players returning from a 95-win season in 2024, this might be the year the “Fightin’ Phils” get the job done.

From the season’s first pitch to the final out, I think the Phillies will be one of the best and most interesting teams to watch in 2025. Stay on this page to find out how you can catch all the action on TV.

Jump to:

  • Philadelphia Phillies channels
  • Best ways to watch the Phillies
  • Philadelphia Phillies TV schedule

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Philadelphia Phillies games?

You can watch the Phillies play most of their games on NBC Sports Philadelphia (NBCSP), with a handful of regional matchups also airing on NBCSP+ and NBC10 this season. The reigning NL East champs will also play on Apple TV+, ESPN, FOX, FS1, MLB Network, The Roku Channel, and TBS.

If you’re an out-of-market fan, you can watch every regional Phillies broadcast through MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS.

Want radio coverage? The Phillies Radio Network offers listening options to fans in Pennsylvania, Delaware, and New Jersey. Spanish-language broadcasts are also available in the Philly area on WTTM 1680 AM.

If you live outside of those three states, you’ll need to use MLB At Bat or SiriusXM to listen to Phillies games.

Best TV plans for watching the Philadelphia Phillies

Do you love options? I sure do. Here are three different ways you can watch the Phillies on TV in 2025. Just keep in mind, games airing on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel are not available through any traditional TV providers.

Phillies.TV ($24.99/mo.)

Up first on my list of ways to watch the Philadelphia Phillies in 2025 is the team’s standalone in-market TV package, Phillies.TV.

Local fans can access the Phillies.TV subscription through MLB.com and the MLB app to watch every game that airs in the designated Phillies broadcast area. That’s more than 140 games without in-market blackout restrictions. You’ll only miss the games that air exclusively on national TV.

Peacock ($10.99–$16.99/mo.)

If you already have Peacock, this might be the best option for you. The service offers an add-on subscription to NBC Sports Philadelphia for basically the same price ($24.95/mo.) as Phillies.TV. And the nice thing about watching the Phillies on Peacock is you don’t have to download another streaming app.

For those who don’t already have Peacock, you’ll need to purchase the platform’s Premium ($7.99/mo.) or Premium Plus ($13.99/mo.) plan before you buy the NBCSP add-on.

Hulu + Live TV ($81.99–$95.99/mo.)

Hulu + Live TV offers the most complete coverage for fans looking to watch the Phillies this season. It has all the channels you need, and both of its base plans include ESPN+, which is perfect for those who watch more than just baseball.

I also love Hulu + Live TV because it doesn’t charge a fee to watch regional sports networks like NBC Sports Philadelphia.

Score the best TV plan!

The Phillies had themselves a stellar season and were rewarded with a spot in the National League Division Series. They’ll play the winner of the Wild Card Series between the Cincinnati Reds and Los Angeles Dodgers, which is currently underway.

How to watch the Philadelphia Phillies FAQ

Can I watch the Philadelphia Phillies for free?

Yes, you can watch the Philadelphia Phillies for free with an over-the-air antenna when games air on channels like NBC10 (in the Philly area) and FOX. Check out the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to see which channels are available where you live.

What apps can I watch Phillies games on this season?

You can watch Philadelphia Phillies games on several apps in 2025, depending on the broadcaster for each game and your own TV subscriptions. Here are some of the apps you can use:

  • Apple TV
  • ESPN
  • FOX Sports
  • MLB
  • Peacock
  • Roku
  • Watch TBS

Is NBC Sports Philadelphia+ an overflow channel?

Yes, NBC Sports Philadelphia+ is an overflow channel that’s used when multiple local teams (Phillies, Flyers, 76ers) play games at the same time. Even when there’s no scheduling conflict, the channel sometimes airs extra content not shown on the main NBC Sports Philadelphia channel.

Why do the Phillies play on so many channels in 2025?

Along with the three local channels that broadcast Phillies games, the team is likely playing on so many national channels in 2025 because they’re expected to have a good season.

Why you should trust us

To create this watch guide, I carefully reviewed multiple sources that provided key details about the Philadelphia Phillies’ 2025 broadcast schedule. After several hours of research, I identified and recommended three distinct ways for fans to watch the Phillies this season. All three options have unique strengths that make them stand out.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Phoenix Mercury Season
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
The Phoenix Mercury’s gritty return to playoff contention in 2024 has fans buzzing for the 2025 season. Here’s how you can watch every game as they look to make an even deeper run.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Phoenix Mercury Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Phoenix Mercury turned some heads in 2024, clawing their way back into playoff relevance with a 19–21 record and a 7th seed finish, which more than doubled their win total from the year before. With Kahleah Copper leading the charge and Brittney Griner anchoring the paint, the Mercury showed flashes of their championship DNA, even as they bowed out in the first round to Minnesota. It was a season of grit, growth, and a glimpse at what could be.

This year, things are looking up, and the Mercury are striving for greatness. With Diana Taurasi retired and Griner now in Atlanta, the Mercury retooled in a big way. They brought in All-Stars Alyssa Thomas and Satou Sabally, added veteran guard Sami Whitcomb, and handed the keys to second-year head coach Nate Tibbetts. They now have a deeper, faster, more versatile squad that’s already making noise in 2025. Are we in for a surprise this year? They just may be my sleeper pick for the season.

What channels have Phoenix Mercury games?

The Phoenix Mercury will be showcased across a wide range of platforms throughout the 2025 season. According to their current schedule, most national broadcasts will air on ION and Amazon Prime Video, with additional games on NBA TV, ESPN3, CBS Sports Network, and ABC/ESPN+. Locally, fans in Arizona can tune in via Arizona’s Family (3TV, CBS 5) and Arizona’s Family Sports.

Pro tip: In-market fans can stream most Phoenix Mercury games live through Merc+, the team’s official platform now available on Roku, Apple TV, and Amazon Fire TV. Nationally televised games are excluded, but Merc+ offers full access to local broadcasts, preseason matchups, and exclusive behind-the-scenes content.

2025 Phoenix Mercury TV schedule

The 2025 season marks the 28th year for the Phoenix Mercury, one of the WNBA’s original franchises. With a passionate fan base and a long history of success, the Mercury are always a must-watch team.

This year, the team has taken a big step forward, finishing the regular season with a stellar 27–17 record. Now, as they head into the postseason, the big question is whether they can turn that regular-season success into something more. Best TV plans for watching the Phoenix Mercury

If you never want to miss a Mercury game, you’ll need a TV plan that covers you both locally and nationally.

WNBA League Pass is your go-to for replays and all out-of-market games. But since the Mercury are featured on a mix of national platforms, you’ll want a streaming service that carries those channels. Fubo checks most of those boxes, and even carries local channels for in-market fans. Though you’ll also need a separate Amazon Prime Video subscription to access the Mercury’s six Prime Video games this season.

Here are the details to help you choose the best TV service for following the WNBA.

Fubo ($14.99–$94.99/mo.)

Fubo is a solid pick for Phoenix Mercury fans who want both national and local coverage in one place. It offers access to major networks airing Mercury games in 2025, like ION, CBS Sports Network, NBA TV, and ABC, and you even get local Arizona stations such as 3TV and Arizona’s Family Sports, which carry in-market broadcasts.

One thing I’ll bring to your attention is that you may need the Fubo Extra or Elite package to unlock channels like NBA TV. But if you’re in the Phoenix area and want a one-stop streaming solution, Fubo covers a lot of ground.

WNBA LeaguePass ($12.99/mo.)

Since the WNBA season skips winter, you may be out living your best life during the warmer months. That means you’ll need a way to watch Mercury games on your own time, and WNBA League Pass is a smart backup. It’s built for fans who want flexibility, offering full replays and out-of-market games you can stream anytime.

Keep in mind that live games shown nationally (like those on ESPN, ION, and Prime Video) and locally may be blacked out due to broadcast rights. But the good news is that those matchups usually unlock for replay not long after the final buzzer.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Phoenix Mercury for free

If you’re hoping to watch the Mercury without cracking open your wallet, your options are limited, but not nonexistent. A handful of nationally televised games (seven, to be exact) air for free on ION, so keep an “eye on” the schedule for those gems.

Also, WNBA League Pass occasionally tosses out free game previews during the season, which is nice if you’re out of market or just curious about the Mercury. And if you’re in Arizona, Arizona’s Family (3TV/CBS 5) will broadcast 36 Mercury games locally, no cable required, just a digital antenna and you’re good to go.

Amazon Prime Video also sometimes offers free trials, and they’ve got a few Mercury games on deck this season. So if you time it right, you might just sneak in a game or two on the house.

How to watch the Phoenix Mercury FAQ

How can I watch the Mercury if I live outside of Arizona?

Fans outside the Phoenix Mercury TV market can use WNBA League Pass to stream all the out-of-market games that aren’t on a national channel. A season-long subscription costs $34.99 and comes with on-demand replays of every WNBA game this season.

How can I stream Phoenix Mercury games?

You have several options for streaming the Mercury. Locally, Merc+ is a solid standalone option for in-market coverage. But nationally, you’ll want a live TV streaming service like DIRECTV, Fubo, or YouTube TV. You’ll also need an Amazon Prime Video subscription for its exclusive games.

What radio station is the Phoenix Mercury on?

Locally, you can listen to Phoenix Mercury coverage on Arizona Sports 98.7 FM. Live WNBA games also air nationwide on SiriusXM NBA Radio (ch. 86).

Have the Phoenix Mercury ever won a championship?

The Phoenix Mercury secured three WNBA championships in 2007, 2009, and 2014.

Who is #2 on the Phoenix Mercury?

Number two on the Phoenix Mercury is none other than the four-time all-star, 2021 Finals MVP, and versatile offensive threat that is Kahleah Copper. She started her career on the bench in 2016 with the Washington Mystics, but had a breakout performance in 2021, leading the Chicago Sky to their first-ever WNBA championship.

Why you should trust us

No one wants to do a ton of research in order to figure out where they can watch their favorite teams and players in action. But … we do! You can rest assured that our comprehensive guide covers all the most pertinent information related to watching the Phoenix Mercury in 2025, locally, nationally, and for free, when possible.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: NFL Schedule This Week: Your TV Guide to Every Week 5 Game
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Get ready for game day with our NFL TV schedule guide. We update this page weekly during the NFL regular season, so you can easily find kick-off times and channel listings for the week’s biggest matchups.

The post NFL Schedule This Week: Your TV Guide to Every Week 5 Game appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
October is here, which means it’s officially spooky season. But for me, the best part of fall isn’t just the candy corn and pumpkin patches; it’s that the NFL season is really starting to heat up. Speaking of spookiness, if you’re a horror movie fan, don’t forget to apply for our Halloween “Thrillternship” Dream Job before the October 7 deadline. One lucky applicant will get paid $666 to watch horror movies.

After a wild Week 4 that saw a 40–40 tie on Sunday night and the Chiefs’ offense finally come back to life, the league feels as unpredictable as ever. The biggest story for me was watching the Ravens’ championship hopes get decimated by injuries, while rookie QB Jaxson Dart led the Giants to a stunning upset win over the previously undefeated Chargers.

With four teams on a bye, this week’s NFL schedule is a bit lighter. But it’s still packed with high-stakes matchups, including three pretty solid primetime games. I’ve laid out the complete Week 5 TV schedule below, including kick-off times and channel listings.

Jump to:

  • CTV’s NFL Game of the Week
  • NFL TV schedule this week

Bookmark this page. Stay updated with the NFL schedule all season by saving this page to your web browser.

Find the best TV provider for football

Enter your zip code below to see the top-ranked TV providers available in your area.

CableTV.com’s NFL Game of the Week

San Francisco 49ers at Los Angeles Rams | Amazon Prime Video

Coverage begins Thursday, October 2, at 8:15 p.m. ET: The best game of Week 5 is the one that kicks it all off. This Thursday night showdown is a massive, early-season battle for first place in the NFC West between the 3–1 49ers and the 3–1 Rams. Los Angeles is rolling after a big win over the Colts, while the Niners are looking to prove last week’s loss was just a fluke.

I’ll be watching the chess match between Rams QB Matthew Stafford and the San Francisco defense. Stafford has been playing at an MVP level. He’s now facing a Niners defense that, since losing Nick Bosa for the season, has struggled to pressure the quarterback. On the other side, the Rams must find an answer for Christian McCaffrey, who has absolutely dominated them in recent matchups. The big X-factor is the health of 49ers QB Brock Purdy, who’s dealing with a good ole toe injury.

Overall, this matchup feels like a toss-up. But with Stafford playing at such a high level and the game being at home, I’m giving a slight edge to the Rams. Remember, this is the week’s Thursday Night Football matchup, which means it streams exclusively on Prime Video for most of the country. Local fans can also catch the game airing in Los Angeles on KTVU (FOX 2) and in the Bay Area on KTTV (FOX 11).

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest must-watch sporting events, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

NFL TV schedule this week

Every NFL regular-season game airs nationally except for the regional Sunday afternoon matchups on CBS and FOX. If you want live access to out-of-market games, you’ll need NFL Sunday Ticket or NFL RedZone’s whip-around coverage. All local and primetime games stream live on NFL+ for mobile device users.

Below is the complete list of NFL Week 5 matchups. You can also check out 506 Sports’ broadcast map to see which Sunday games will air in your region.

Game Date Time (ET) Channels
San Francisco 49ers at Los Angeles Rams Thursday, Oct. 2 8:15 p.m. Amazon Prime Video
Minnesota Vikings at Cleveland Browns (in London) Sunday, Oct. 5 9:30 a.m. NFL Network
Houston Texans at Baltimore Ravens Sunday, Oct. 5 1:00 p.m. CBS, Paramount+
Miami Dolphins at Carolina Panthers Sunday, Oct. 5 1:00 p.m. FOX
Las Vegas Raiders at Indianapolis Colts Sunday, Oct. 5 1:00 p.m. FOX
New York Giants at New York Giants Sunday, Oct. 5 1:00 p.m. CBS, Paramount+
Dallas Cowboys at New York Jets Sunday, Oct. 5 1:00 p.m. FOX
Denver Broncos at Philadelphia Eagles Sunday, Oct. 5 1:00 p.m. CBS, Paramount+
Tennessee Titans at Arizona Cardinals Sunday, Oct. 5 4:05 p.m. CBS, Paramount+
Tampa Bay Buccaneers at Seattle Seahawks Sunday, Oct. 5 4:05 p.m. CBS, Paramount+
Detroit Lions at Cincinnati Bengals Sunday, Oct. 5 4:25 p.m. FOX
Washington Commanders at Los Angeles Chargers Sunday, Oct. 5 4:25 p.m. FOX
New England Patriots at Buffalo Bills Sunday, Oct. 5 8:20 p.m. NBC, UNIVERSO, Peacock
Kansas City Chiefs at Jacksonville Jaguars Monday, Oct. 6 8:15 p.m. ESPN, ABC, ESPN2, ESPN Deportes

Data effective as of post date. CBS and FOX games air in select markets.

Don’t miss your local NFL team in action

Enter your zip code below to find the best TV plans in your area that offer local and primetime NFL channels.

NFL Schedule This Week FAQ

What week is it in the NFL?

It’s currently Week 5 of the 2025 NFL regular season. This is a key week on the calendar, as it marks the first time teams will be on a bye.

Which NFL teams have a bye this week?

The four teams on a bye in Week 5 are the Atlanta Falcons, Chicago Bears, Green Bay Packers, and Pittsburgh Steelers.

Who is the best team in the NFL today?

After four weeks, the only two undefeated teams remaining are the Philadelphia Eagles and the Buffalo Bills, who are holding down the top two spots in the NFL Power Rankings. After their big Monday night win, the Detroit Lions have also solidified their place in the top three.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, has been writing and refining this weekly NFL schedule guide since the 2022 season. Each week, he reviews the official league schedule and cross-references it with every broadcast partner. This process assures the channel listings for each matchup—including Spanish-language and alternate broadcasts—are always accurate.

Taylor’s “Game of the Week” selection comes from that hands-on experience, as he watches multiple games in their entirety every game week. His pick is a blend of on-field analysis (team performance, playoff stakes) and off-field expertise (broadcast accessibility). That dedicated, hands-on experience is what gives this TV guide a true fan’s perspective.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about CableTV.com and the methods we use.

Game day starts here!
